[File: aptos-core/api/src/state.rs] [Function: raw_value()] [StateValue serialization DoS] Does bcs::to_bytes(&state_value) at line 569 bound the size of serialized output, or can attackers query state values that serialize to gigabyte-sized responses causing memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/state.rs] [Function: get_raw_state_value()] [Experimental endpoint exposure] Does the 'hidden' tag at line 241 properly prevent discovery and access to the experimental endpoint, or can attackers enumerate and abuse this endpoint for unauthorized state access? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/state.rs] [Function: raw_table_item()] [JSON response leakage] Can the api_forbidden check at line 512 be bypassed, or does error handling accidentally leak raw table data in JSON format through error messages or logging? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/state.rs] [Function: resource()] [Converter race condition] Does as_converter() at line 290 create thread-safe converters, or can concurrent requests cause race conditions in the converter's internal state leading to type confusion or data corruption? (High)
